content.description: Dr. Palmer randomly assigned people who had no dancing experience to one of two groups. Each group was taught a brief dance routine. Then one group performed the new routine in front of a group of strangers. The other group performed the new routine in front of a group of stuffed animals. The number of mistakes made during the routine was counted.
content.question: Which of the following is true about the research study?

choices.label: The type of dance learned is a confounding variable.
The study relied on a convenience sample.
The research study was an experiment.
The professor only collected qualitative data.

content.answer: The research study was an experiment.

skill.text: 2.A: Determine the type of research design(s) used in a given study.
